body_html: @mrry Thanks for your answer :) Yes, for TF 0.8, we used the same profiling tool to test it, and still got linear performance decay as running time goes by. Actually, I'm really eager to show all my code here, but the complete code has more than 2000 lines... But I can show you the data shape that I defined: it's [array([[…], …, […]]), array([[…], …, […]]), …, array([[…], …, […]])] - list with dimensions 32 * 336 * 84.

body: @mrry Thanks for your answer :) Yes, for TF 0.8, we used the same profiling tool to test it, and still got linear performance decay as running time goes by. Actually, I'm really eager to show all my code here, but the complete code has more than 2000 lines... But I can show you the data shape that I defined: it's `[array([[…], …, […]]), array([[…], …, […]]), …, array([[…], …, […]])]` - list with dimensions 32 \* 336 \* 84.
